THE CODUCTOR LINED BACK THE SOUTH CROSSOVER SWITCHES FOR THE FVW MAIN AND HE LET THE CREW ON FDBR1T-30 KNOW THAT THE TRACK WAS LINED FORTHEM TO DEPART.  Y103 CREW THEN PROCEEDED WITH THE LIGHT ENGINE NORTHWARDS UP THE MARSH LINE TOWARDLAKESHORE DRIVE.  AT ABOUT 10:10 A.M. FDBR1T-30 STARTED TO DEPART OFF OF TRACK 57 USING NORTH CROSSOVER AND TO PROCEED DOWN THE FVW MAIN. AT APPROXIMATELY 10:15 A.M. JOB Y103 SAW THE TRAIN DEPARTING ON THE TRACK NEXT TO THEM.  THE CONDUCTOR THROUGH THAT THE ENGINEER WOULD BE STOPPING OVER LAKESHOREDRIVER WHILE THE TRAIN PASSED.  THE ENGINEER ASKED THE CONDUCTOR IF THEY WERE LINED UP AND THE CONDUCTOR RESPONDED "NO".  AFTER A FEW SECONDS AND NO REPLY FROM THE ENGINEER, THE CONDUCTOR SAID "STOP",STOP AND STILL NO REPLY.  IT WAS AT THIS TIME THAT THE LIGHT ENGINE IMPACTED THE SIDE OF TRAIN FDBR1T-30. G5210-d-06-21-02-WC.Narrative: INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT SSAM 2403 WAS THE FIRST CAR TO DERAIL AT MILEPOST 170.95.THE TRAIN HAD CONTINUED ON AFTER SSAM 2403 DERAILED UNTIL MILEPOST 173.25 WHERE 5 CARS ENDED UP DERAILED.  ALTHOUGH NONE OF THE INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS ON THE TRUCK WERE CONDEMNABLE UNDER FRA OR AAR STANDARDS, THE COMBINATION OF WEAR ON MULTIPLE COMPONENTS CAUSED THE CAR TO BE SUSCEPTIBLE TO ANY MINOR DEVIATIONS TRACK CONDITION AT A 15 FOOT INTERVAL (TRUCK CENTERS)AND /OR TRAIN SPEED.  THE LOSS OFFREE LATERAL CAUSED BY THE CONVERSION OF THE FRICTION BEARING TRUCKS TO ROLLER BEARING TRUCKS FURTHER INCREASES THE SENSITIVITY OF THE TRUCK TO TRACK DEVIATION AND TRAIN HANDLING.  THE TRACK AT AND LEADING UP TO THE POINT OF DERAILMENT FALLS WELL WITHIN THE STANDARDS FOR CLASS 3 TRACK.  THERE IS AREDUCTION OF 3/8" IN THE SUPER ELEVATION AT THE POINT OF DERAILMENT FORM A POINT 15"- 6" SOUTH OF THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  IN A NORMAL TRUCK THIS  WOULD TEND TO PLACE MORE FORCE AGAINST THE HIGH RAILBUT WITH THE SHORT 15' TRUCK CENTERS IT WOULD HAVE THE EFFECT OF UNLOADING THE NORTH END OF THE CARAS THE SOUTH END OF THE CAR PASSED OVER THE AREA OF GREATER SUPER ELEVATION.NoneNoneNone

0602CB003-d-06-01-02-UP.Narrative: THERE WAS A VERY THOROUGH INVESTIGATION THAT WAS PERFORMED INVOLVING REGIONAL, SERVICE UNIT AND DERAILMENT PREVENTION REPRESENTATIVES.  THERE WERE EXTENSIVE STUDIES AND FIELD MEASUREMENTS PERFORMED INTHE ANALYSIS PROCESS OF THIS DERAILMENT AND THE CAUSE WAS GENERATED BASED ON THE FACTS.  THE DETAILED ANALYSIS DID NOT GENERATE ANY DEVATIONS FROM THE STANDARDS.  THE ANALYSIS FOUND THAT THERE WAS NOT A DEFINITIVE DEVIATION THAT WOULD BE CAUSATIVE FOR THE DERAILMENT, THE DERAILMENT WAS A RESULT OFA NUMBER OF PARAMETERS INTERACTING.  THE FOLLOWING WRITE-UP IS THE MORE DETAILED WRITE-UP THAT WAS DEVELOPED AS A RESULT OF THE INVESTIGATION.  PROGRESSIVE WEAKENING OF THE TRACK STRUCTURE DUE TO: THEINFLUENCE OF TRAIN DYNAMIC UPLIFT; INCREASED LATERAL LOADS FROM GAUGE WIDENING (1/2");  INCREASED THERMAL FORCES IN THE RAIL; THE INFLUENCE OF THE HEAVY VERTICAL CAR LOADS; AND THE CURVATURE EFFECTS.THE PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF THE TRACK STRUCTURE AND THE TRAIN PARAMETERS CAUSED THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TRAIN INDUCED MISALIGNMENT.  THE MISALIGNMENT GREW TO A POINT WHERE THE WHEEL ON THE CAR NORX3174 R2 CLIMED OVER THE TOP OF THE RAIL.  IN DEPTH ANALYSIS VERIFIED THAT THIS WAS NOT A TRACK BUCKLE.NoneNone

0000149582-d-06-10-02-IC.Narrative: BNSF TRAIN WAS LINED FROM TRACK #2 TO THE OLD WYE AT CORWITH TOWER AND APPARENTLY HAD A CAR DERAIL THAT RAN OVER SWITCH MACHINES.  INITIAL CLAIM WAS THAT A LIGHTENING STRIKE OCCURRED AT THE SAME TIMEAS THE DERAILMENT AND THE SWITCH HAD POSSIBLY MOVED UNDER THE TRAIN.  HOWEVER, OUR INVESTIGATION PROVED:  1) THE SWITCH MACHINE WAS STILL LINED AND LOCKED FOR THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN; 2) CONTROLS INTHE OPERATING TOWER INDICATE THE SWITCH WAS STILL LINED AND LOCKED FOR THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN; 3) CONTROLS IN THE TOWER SHOWED NO INDICATIONS OF TAMPERING; 4) RERAILING HAD ALREADY BEGUN AND SEVERAL CARS WERE PULLED THROUGHT THE SWITCH WITH THE POINTS LINED AGAINST THEIR MOVEMENT.  ALSO NOTE THAT IC EMPLOYEE WORKING IN INTERLOCKING TOWER DID NOT SIGN A WAIVER AND ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR DERAILMENT.  ILLINOIS CENTRAL SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO FIVE SWITCH MACHINES.  TRACK MAINTENANCE IS BNSF.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

021-d-06-27-02-CMSX.Narrative: THE ENGINEER OF TRAIN NO. 37 CONFIRMED THAT THE CROSSING WARNING DEVICES (FLASHING LIGHTS AND WARNING BELL) WERE FUNCTIONING AS INTENDED.  THE ENGINEER ALSO CONFIRMED THAT BOTH FRONT LOCOMOTIVE HEADLIGHTS WERE FUNCTIONING (IN THE BRIGHT MODE), THE LOCOMOTIVE BELL WAS FUNCTIONING, AND HE WAS BLOWINGTHE HORN AS REQUIRED WHILE APPROACHING THE CROSSING.  THERE WERE AT LEAST 25 WITNESSES (BOTH TRAIN PASSENGERS AND DRIVERS OF OTHER MOTOR VEHICLES IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA OF THE ACCIDENT) THAT HAVE ATTESTED TO THE FACT THAT ALL OF THE ABOVE WARNING DEVICES (LOCOMOTIVE AND WAYSIDE) WERE FUNCTIONING AS INTENDED.  AS TRAIN NO. 307 APPROACHED THE CROSSING, THE ENGINEER OBSERVED THAT A DUMP TRUCK, ALSO TRAVELLING IN THE SOUTWARD DIRECTION ON MAGNOLIA DRIVE (PARALLEL WITH THE TRAIN) WAS ABOUT TO TURN RIGHT FROM MAGNOLIA DRIVE ONTO CHURCH STREET.  IN SPITE OF ALL OF THE PRVIOUSLY MENTIONED WARNING DEVICES FUNCTIONING, THE DRIVER OF THE DUMP TRUCK TURNED RIGHT AND DIRECTLY INTO THE TRAIN, STRIKING THELEFT FRONT CORNER OF THE TRAIN, CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE RAIL DIESEL CAR AND TOTALLY DESTROYING THE DUMP TRUCK.  THE TRUCK DRIVER STATED (AS PER THE MIDDLE TOWNSHIP POLICE DEPARTMENT POLICE CRASH REPORT) THAT HE DID NOT SEE THE WARNING LIGHTS OR THE TRAIN, AND ALSO DID NOT HEAR THE TRAIN HORNOR THE WARNING BELLS.  THE DRIVER REFUSED MEDICAL TREATMENT AND DRUG/ALCOHOL USE CONNECTED WITH THEACCIDENT IS UNDETERMINED.  NEITHER FUEL TANK (LOCOMOTIVE OR DUMP TRUCK) WAS PUNCTURED OR AFFECTED B
